result.execSummary:
The defendant Laponzo M Dallas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Motion to Object the the Courts Finding of Defendant ABS Paying for an Attorney Appointed by the Request of Judge Siefert as Stand-By Counsel and the Sentencing is Unconstitutional.
Affidavit and order for payment of attorney fees and costs signed.  Filed by Canfield & Ertl LLC  $888.00
Affidavit and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs, signed and filed.

Court appointed Atty. Christopher Ertl to represent defendant at County expense and at the rate of $60/hour.  Court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $60/month commencing at the close of the case with authorization for repayment through civil judgment, tax intercept or wage assignment.  Appointment of Attorney at County Expense signed and filed.

Defendant Laponzo M Dallas in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl as a friend of the court.  Defendant Laponzo M Dallas in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 6 months time served. Time serve disposition.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) by 1/13/2017, or to be docketed as a civil judgment/tax intercept.

per order dated October 25, 2016, Appeal 2016AP616W, the motion is denied for lack of jurisdiction.

Defendant Laponzo M Dallas in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl as stand by counsel. Defendant Laponzo M Dallas in custody. Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial.

Pretrial discussions placed on the record.

Colloquy between court and defendant regarding defendant's right to represent himself. Court accepts defendant's waiver of counsel.

Defendant requests a court trial. Colloquy between court and defendant regarding defendant's right to a jury trial. Court accepts defendan'ts waiver of a jury trial.

Discussion regarding State's Motion in Limine placed on the record.

Trial proceeded.  

Sworn for the state: Loss Prevention Officer Brandon Thomas.

Parties watch exhibit 1.

State rests subject to rebuttal. 

State and defense rest.  

Testimony closed.  

Closing arguments by state and defense.  

Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

per order dated May 25, 2016, Appeal 2016AP616W on cases 15CM1586 and 16CF700, in the interest of Judicial efficiency, the petiions for writs of habeas corpus filed on March 24, 2016, and May 4, 2016, are consolidated for dispostion purposes. The consolidated petitions for writs of habeas corpus are denied ex parte. Any procedural motions filed in aid of these petitions, including the motion to compel production of jail records, are denied.

Defendant Laponzo M Dallas in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Laponzo M Dallas in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm
Case in court on defense motion to withdraw as counsel.   Attorney Guimont informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court. Defendant informs the Court he wants to represent himself, court grants defendant's motion to represent himself, however, Court appoints Attorney Christopher Ertl to be STAND BY COUNSEL on defendants behalf at $60 per hours, all parties agreed.  Attorney Guimont turned over discovery to Attorney Ertl. Court ordered Jury Trial set for 7-20-2016 Vacated. Case adjourned for status conference in branch 47  Status conference scheduled for August 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.
